{{dablink|For the 1963 film, see [[The V.I.P.s]].}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The V.I.P.'s | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | birth_name = | alias = The Vipps, Art (1967) | origin = [[Carlisle, Cumbria|Carlisle]], [[England]] | instrument = | genre = [[Rhythm and Blues|R&B]], [[psychedelic rock]] | occupation = | years_active = 1963â1967 | label = [[Island Records|Island]], [[CBS Records|CBS]], [[Star-Club Records|Star-Club]] | associated_acts = [[Spooky Tooth]] | website = | current_members = [[Mike Harrison (musician)|Mike Harrison]]
[[Greg Ridley]]
Frank Kenyon
Jimmy Henshaw
[[Luther Grosvenor]]
Walter Johnstone
[[Mike Kellie]]
[[Keith Emerson]] | past_members = | notable_instruments = [[Gretsch]] [[guitar]]s }} '''The V.I.P.'s''' were a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] [[musical ensemble]] formed in [[Carlisle, Cumbria|Carlisle]], [[Cumberland]], ([[North West England]]) in late 1963, out of an earlier outfit known as The Ramrods, who had formed in Carlisle in 1960. After a change of personnel in April 1967, the band changed their name to ''Art'', and released the album ''[[Supernatural Fairy Tales]]''. ==Career== The band members at various times were: [[Mike Harrison (musician)|Mike Harrison]] (lead vocals) (ex Dino and the Danubes, [[The Dakotas (band)|The Dakotas]], The Ramrods); [[Greg Ridley]] ([[bass guitar]]) (ex Dino and the Danubes, The Dakotas); Frank Kenyon ([[rhythm guitar]]) (1963â67) (born 12 October 1945, Carlisle) (ex The Teenages, The Ramrods); Jimmy Henshaw ([[lead guitar]]) (1963â67) (born James Henshaw, 20 October 1941, in [[Newarthill]], near [[Motherwell]], [[North Lanarkshire]], [[Scotland]] died 1 May 2007, Carlisle) (ex The Ramrods); [[Keith Emerson]] ([[electric organ]]) (1966â1967); [[Luther Grosvenor]] (lead guitar) (1967); Walter Johnstone ([[drummer]]) (1963â67) (born 11 March 1943, Carlisle) (ex The Teenages, The Ramrods); and [[Mike Kellie]] (drummer) (1967). When Emerson left in early 1967, Harrison, Ridley, Grosvenor and Kellie changed their name to 'Art', and released one [[album]], ''[[Supernatural Fairy Tales]]'', produced by [[Guy Stevens]], before becoming [[Spooky Tooth]]. ==Discography== ===Singles=== *"She's So Good" / "Don't Keep Shouting At Me" ([[United Kingdom|UK]] [[RCA Records|RCA]], 1964) *"Mercy Mercy" / "That's My Woman" ([[United States|U.S.]] only single, produced by [[Derek Lawrence]] *"Wintertime" / "Anyone" (as The Vipps, [[CBS Records|CBS]]) *"I Wanna Be Free" / "Don't Let It Go" ([[Island Records|Island]]) *"Straight Down to the Bottom" / "In A Dream" (Island) *"Sunshine Help Me" (Island - as 'Art') ===Albums=== *''[[Supernatural Fairy Tales]]'' (Island ILP967 - as 'Art') ===Compilation albums=== *[[Compact disc|CD]] [[compilation album|compilation]]: ''The Complete V.I.P.s'' ([[double album]], 28 tracks) ([[Repertoire Records]])[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r937823/review|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic - Album review] ==References== {{Reflist}} * Larkin, C: 'The Virgin Encyclopedia of Sixties Music' p18 (Muze Uk Ltd, 1997) ISBN: 0-7535-0149-X ==External links== *[http://www.myspace.com/thevips65 The V.I.P.'s at Myspace] *[http://www.btinternet.com/~fenderstrat/VIPs.htm Cumbrian Bands of the 60s: The Vipps] *[http://www.gregridley.com/ Greg Ridley] {{Spooky Tooth}} {{DEFAULTSORT:V.I.P.'s, The}} [[Category:Musical groups established in 1963]] [[Category:Musical groups disestablished in 1967]] [[Category:English rock music groups]] [[Category:Beat groups]] [[nl:The V.I.P.'s]]
